question: At which place the first Danish East India company factory was established in India?
explanation: In 1616 AD, the Danish East India company established their first factory at Tranquebar in Tamilnadu (1620) and Serampur in Bengal (1676). In India, Serampur was their headquaters. Though, they failed to strengthen themselves in India and finally in the beginning of 19th century, they sold all their settlements to the British and went back to their country.
